seed_pair.known: I want to speak Spanish with you now.
seed_pair.target: Quiero hablar español contigo ahora.

seed_pair.known: I'm trying to learn.
seed_pair.target: Estoy intentando aprender.

legos.teaches: Spanish progressive tense uses estar + gerund (-ando/-iendo)

seed_pair.known: how to speak as often as possible
seed_pair.target: cómo hablar lo más a menudo posible

legos.teaches: Spanish uses cómo + infinitive for how to do something
Spanish superlative construction with lo más + adverb + posible

seed_pair.known: how to say something in Spanish
seed_pair.target: cómo decir algo en español

legos.teaches: how to + verb uses cómo + infinitive in Spanish

seed_pair.known: I'm going to practise speaking with someone else.
seed_pair.target: Voy a practicar hablar con otra persona.

legos.teaches: ir + a + infinitive construction for future intent
someone else expressed as another person in Spanish

seed_pair.known: I'm trying to remember a word.
seed_pair.target: Estoy intentando recordar una palabra.

legos.teaches: present progressive with estar + -ando gerund form

seed_pair.known: I want to try as hard as I can today.
seed_pair.target: Quiero intentar lo más que pueda hoy.

legos.teaches: Comparative maximum structure with subjunctive pueda (can/be able)

seed_pair.known: I'm going to try to explain what I mean.
seed_pair.target: Voy a intentar explicar lo que quiero decir.

legos.teaches: Ir + a + infinitive structure for near future tense
Relative clause with lo que plus idiomatic querer decir meaning to mean

seed_pair.known: I speak a little Spanish now.
seed_pair.target: Hablo un poco de español ahora.

legos.teaches: Partitive structure un poco de required before nouns unlike English a little

seed_pair.known: I'm not sure if I can remember the whole sentence.
seed_pair.target: No estoy seguro de si puedo recordar toda la oración.

legos.teaches: Negation placement (no before verb) with estar + adjective
Conditional si + conjugated verb (subject pronoun dropped)
Word order: toda (whole) precedes the article+noun

seed_pair.known: I'd like to be able to speak after you finish.
seed_pair.target: Me gustaría poder hablar después de que termines.

legos.teaches: Gustar construction in conditional - indirect object pronoun + conditional verb
Después de que triggers subjunctive mood (termines not terminas)

seed_pair.known: I wouldn't like to guess what's going to happen tomorrow.
seed_pair.target: No me gustaría adivinar qué va a pasar mañana.

legos.teaches: Negated gustar construction - no precedes the indirect object pronoun
Ir a + infinitive for near future; qué as interrogative pronoun

seed_pair.known: You speak Spanish very well.
seed_pair.target: Hablas español muy bien.

seed_pair.known: Do you speak Spanish all day?
seed_pair.target: ¿Hablas español todo el día?

legos.teaches: Spanish requires article el - literally all the day

seed_pair.known: And I want you to speak Spanish with me tomorrow.
seed_pair.target: Y quiero que hables español conmigo mañana.

legos.teaches: want someone to X requires que + subjunctive

seed_pair.known: He wants to come back with everyone else later on.
seed_pair.target: Él quiere volver con todos los demás más tarde.

legos.teaches: everyone else becomes all the others (todos los demás)
later uses comparative structure más tarde (more late)

seed_pair.known: She wants to find out what the answer is.
seed_pair.target: Ella quiere saber cuál es la respuesta.

legos.teaches: embedded questions keep interrogative word order (cuál es not es cuál)

seed_pair.known: We want to meet at six o clock this evening.
seed_pair.target: Queremos reunirnos a las seis esta tarde.

legos.teaches: time uses a las + number (feminine article las for implied horas)

seed_pair.known: But I don't want to stop talking.
seed_pair.target: Pero no quiero dejar de hablar.

legos.teaches: negation no precedes conjugated verb

seed_pair.known: You want to learn his name quickly.
seed_pair.target: Quieres aprender su nombre rápidamente.

seed_pair.known: Why are you learning her name?
seed_pair.target: ¿Por qué estás aprendiendo su nombre?

legos.teaches: present progressive with estar + gerund

seed_pair.known: Because I want to meet people who speak Spanish.
seed_pair.target: Porque quiero conocer a personas que hablan español.

legos.teaches: Personal a required before people as direct object
Relative pronoun que for who in relative clauses

seed_pair.known: I'm going to start talking more soon.
seed_pair.target: Voy a empezar a hablar más pronto.

legos.teaches: Empezar requires a before following infinitive

seed_pair.known: I'm not going to be able to remember easily.
seed_pair.target: No voy a poder recordar fácilmente.

legos.teaches: Negation no placed before conjugated verb

seed_pair.known: Are you going to help me before I have to go?
seed_pair.target: ¿Vas a ayudarme antes de que tenga que irme?

legos.teaches: Future intention using ir + a + infinitive
Obligation with tener que; subjunctive after antes de que

seed_pair.known: I like feeling as if I'm nearly ready to go.
seed_pair.target: Me gusta sentirme como si estuviera casi listo para irme.

legos.teaches: Gustar construction with indirect object pronoun
Imperfect subjunctive required after como si
Purpose expressed with para + infinitive

seed_pair.known: I don't like taking too much time to answer.
seed_pair.target: No me gusta tomar demasiado tiempo para responder.

legos.teaches: Negation with gustar: no precedes the indirect object pronoun
Purpose clause with para + infinitive

seed_pair.known: It's useful to start talking as soon as you can.
seed_pair.target: Es útil empezar a hablar tan pronto como puedas.

legos.teaches: linking 'a' between consecutive infinitives
subjunctive 'puedas' after 'tan pronto como'

seed_pair.known: I'm looking forward to speaking better as soon as I can.
seed_pair.target: Tengo ganas de hablar mejor tan pronto como pueda.

legos.teaches: idiomatic 'tener ganas de' for 'looking forward to'
subjunctive 'pueda' after 'tan pronto como'

seed_pair.known: I wanted to ask you something yesterday.
seed_pair.target: Quería preguntarte algo ayer.

seed_pair.known: You wanted to speak with me tonight.
seed_pair.target: Querías hablar conmigo esta noche.

seed_pair.known: Did you want to show me something?
seed_pair.target: ¿Querías mostrarme algo?

seed_pair.known: How long have you been learning Spanish?
seed_pair.target: ¿Cuánto tiempo llevas aprendiendo español?

legos.teaches: Spanish expresses duration as how much time
llevar + gerund expresses ongoing duration (how long you have been doing something)

seed_pair.known: He doesn't want to be quiet when other people are here.
seed_pair.target: Él no quiere estar callado cuando otras personas están aquí.

seed_pair.known: She doesn't want to read anything this afternoon.
seed_pair.target: Ella no quiere leer nada esta tarde.

seed_pair.known: We don't want to interrupt the story.
seed_pair.target: No queremos interrumpir la historia.

seed_pair.known: I started to think about it carefully last month.
seed_pair.target: Empecé a pensar en ello cuidadosamente el mes pasado.

legos.teaches: empezar + a + infinitive pattern (linking a required before infinitive)

seed_pair.known: I've been learning for about a week.
seed_pair.target: He estado aprendiendo durante aproximadamente una semana.

legos.teaches: present perfect continuous using haber + estado + gerund

seed_pair.known: But I'm a little tired this morning.
seed_pair.target: Pero estoy un poco cansado esta mañana.

seed_pair.known: How do you feel at the moment?
seed_pair.target: ¿Cómo te sientes en este momento?

legos.teaches: reflexive verb: Spanish uses sentirse (reflexive) for to feel with pronoun before verb
idiomatic: at the moment becomes in this moment in Spanish

seed_pair.known: I feel okay, but I'm starting to feel tired.
seed_pair.target: Me siento bien, pero estoy empezando a sentirme cansado.

legos.teaches: reflexive verb: sentirse uses reflexive pronoun me before conjugated verb
progressive: estar + gerund (-ando) for ongoing action, a links to infinitive
reflexive infinitive: pronoun me attaches to end of infinitive sentir

seed_pair.known: I was starting to feel better than last night.
seed_pair.target: Estaba empezando a sentirme mejor que anoche.

legos.teaches: imperfect progressive: estar in imperfect (estaba) + gerund for ongoing past action
reflexive infinitive: reflexive pronoun me attaches to end of infinitive

seed_pair.known: I was not thinking about how to answer.
seed_pair.target: No estaba pensando en cómo responder.

legos.teaches: Negation placement (no before verb) + past progressive with estar + gerund
Question word cómo + infinitive structure (no preposition needed)

seed_pair.known: Or if I need to improve.
seed_pair.target: O si necesito mejorar.

legos.teaches: Need + infinitive structure with subject pronoun dropped; necesitar takes direct infinitive

seed_pair.known: I do not need to know everything.
seed_pair.target: No necesito saber todo.

lego.known: I do not need to know

legos.teaches: Negation with no before verb + need + infinitive chain; do-support not used in Spanish

seed_pair.known: But I don't worry about making mistakes.
seed_pair.target: Pero no me preocupo por cometer errores.

legos.teaches: reflexive verb with pronoun me placed before conjugated verb
Spanish uses infinitive where English uses gerund (-ing)

seed_pair.known: Because I think that it's a good thing to make mistakes.
seed_pair.target: Porque creo que es algo bueno cometer errores.

legos.teaches: verb + conjunction que pattern for dependent clauses
word order - adjective bueno follows noun algo
infinitive verb phrase as subject/object

seed_pair.known: I don't care about making mistakes.
seed_pair.target: No me importa cometer errores.

legos.teaches: Spanish uses impersonal construction - literally 'it doesn't matter to me' instead of 'I don't care'
preposition 'about' is absorbed - Spanish infinitive directly follows verb

seed_pair.known: It's like this, if you know what I mean.
seed_pair.target: Es así, si sabes lo que quiero decir.

legos.teaches: lo que for what (that which); mean expressed as want to say

seed_pair.known: I'm not trying to finish as quickly as possible.
seed_pair.target: No estoy intentando terminar lo más rápido posible.

legos.teaches: no placement before verb; estar + gerund for present continuous
lo más [adj] posible construction for as [adj] as possible

seed_pair.known: I enjoy doing interesting things with my friends.
seed_pair.target: Disfruto haciendo cosas interesantes con mis amigos.

legos.teaches: adjective placement after noun in Spanish

seed_pair.known: He wanted to write a letter to his friend last week.
seed_pair.target: Él quería escribir una carta a su amigo la semana pasada.

legos.teaches: a introduces recipient/indirect object
adjective follows noun (the week past)

seed_pair.known: She wanted to put his letter in her bag.
seed_pair.target: Ella quería poner su carta en su bolsa.

legos.teaches: su means his/her/your (context determines)
en for in/inside, su for her (same as his)

seed_pair.known: We wanted to give you a little more time.
seed_pair.target: Queríamos darte un poco más de tiempo.

legos.teaches: object pronoun attaches to infinitive
quantity expression word order
de required after más before nouns

seed_pair.known: I do not enjoy waking up when I did not sleep very well.
seed_pair.target: No disfruto despertarme cuando no dormí muy bien.

legos.teaches: Spanish negation no precedes the conjugated verb
Past tense negation uses no before the preterite verb

seed_pair.known: So I can remember how to say a few words.
seed_pair.target: Para poder recordar cómo decir algunas palabras.

legos.teaches: Purpose expression: so I can uses para + infinitive poder
Question word + infinitive pattern for how to verb

seed_pair.known: I cannot remember how to say what I wanted to say.
seed_pair.target: No puedo recordar cómo decir lo que quería decir.

legos.teaches: Modal negation: cannot becomes no + conjugated poder
Question word + infinitive pattern
Relative clause: what as relative pronoun uses lo que

seed_pair.known: It's interesting when you understand enough words.
seed_pair.target: Es interesante cuando entiendes suficientes palabras.

seed_pair.known: I know how to do what I need to do next week.
seed_pair.target: Sé cómo hacer lo que necesito hacer la próxima semana.

legos.teaches: how to + verb uses cómo + infinitive
what I [verb] uses lo que + conjugated verb
time expressions use definite article la

seed_pair.known: I don't know how to say enough different words yet.
seed_pair.target: Todavía no sé cómo decir suficientes palabras diferentes.

legos.teaches: negation places no before the verb
how to + verb uses cómo + infinitive

seed_pair.known: Could you say that again a little more slowly?
seed_pair.target: ¿Podrías decir eso otra vez un poco más despacio?

legos.teaches: Spanish adverb intensification order: quantity + más + adverb

seed_pair.known: I'm not sure if I can help you at the same time.
seed_pair.target: No estoy seguro si puedo ayudarte al mismo tiempo.

legos.teaches: Spanish negation precedes the verb: no + verb + adjective
Contraction a + el = al before masculine nouns

seed_pair.known: Are you sure you don't mind helping me?
seed_pair.target: ¿Estás seguro de que no te importa ayudarme?

legos.teaches: Spanish uses indirect object + importar construction: no te importa (it doesn't matter to you)
Spanish requires de que after seguro when followed by a clause

seed_pair.known: Learning Spanish isn't easy but it is fun.
seed_pair.target: Aprender español no es fácil pero es divertido.

legos.teaches: infinitive form used as subject noun (Spanish uses infinitive where English uses -ing form)

seed_pair.known: It's important to take time to test yourself.
seed_pair.target: Es importante tomar tiempo para ponerte a prueba.

legos.teaches: subject it omitted in Spanish impersonal constructions
para + reflexive verb for purpose clause; idiomatic ponerse a prueba for testing oneself

seed_pair.known: It's not difficult to find the answer.
seed_pair.target: No es difícil encontrar la respuesta.

legos.teaches: negation pattern no es + adjective; subject it is omitted

seed_pair.known: Why do you want to stop?
seed_pair.target: ¿Por qué quieres parar?

seed_pair.known: What are you looking for?
seed_pair.target: ¿Qué buscas?

seed_pair.known: He didn't want to look after the young dog all afternoon.
seed_pair.target: Él no quería cuidar del perro joven toda la tarde.

legos.teaches: Spanish negation places no before the conjugated verb
Spanish adjectives typically follow the noun
All agrees with noun gender - toda for feminine tarde

seed_pair.known: She didn't want to tell me where it was.
seed_pair.target: Ella no quería decirme dónde estaba.

legos.teaches: negation placement before imperfect tense verb

seed_pair.known: We didn't want to let anyone hear the truth.
seed_pair.target: No queríamos dejar que nadie oyera la verdad.

legos.teaches: negation placement with first person plural imperfect
let someone do requires dejar que + subjunctive
definite article required with abstract nouns in Spanish

seed_pair.known: I think that you're doing very well.
seed_pair.target: Creo que lo estás haciendo muy bien.

legos.teaches: present progressive with estar + gerund and object pronoun placement before auxiliary

seed_pair.known: Thank you very much, but I've got more to learn.
seed_pair.target: Muchas gracias, pero tengo más que aprender.

legos.teaches: más que + infinitive pattern for expressing more to verb

seed_pair.known: Thank you very much for helping me to understand.
seed_pair.target: Muchas gracias por ayudarme a entender.

legos.teaches: por + infinitive for 'for doing'; pronoun attachment to infinitive (ayudar+me); 'a' before entender

seed_pair.known: Have you got more to learn?
seed_pair.target: ¿Tienes más que aprender?

legos.teaches: más que + infinitive pattern for 'more to verb'
